ConceptDef.label: SS: Sidearms
ConceptDef.helpText:
Simple Sidearms

In order to equip weapons as sidearms, rightclick them and select the Equip as sidearm option.

Sidearms are listed in the Sidearms gizmo that is displayed when a colonist with at least one weapon is selected. By default, colonists will automatically switch to range-appropriate weapons, and will switch to a melee weapon when engaged in close combat. This behaviour can be altered in the mod settings.

ConceptDef.label: SS: Carried sidearms
ConceptDef.helpText: Sidearms with a gray background are currently in a colonists inventory and eligible for use. Left click to switch to them. Right click to drop.

ConceptDef.label: SS: Inactive primary weapons
ConceptDef.helpText: Sidearms with a golden background are designated as a colonists primary weapon, but are currently not used as such. They will switch back to them once out of combat.

ConceptDef.label: SS: Missing sidearms
ConceptDef.helpText: Sidearms with a dark purple background are currently missing from a colonists loadout. They will attempt to replace them at earliest opportunity, assuming any can be found. Right click to forget about the sidearm.

ConceptDef.label: SS: Advanced controls
ConceptDef.helpText: Colonists can have sidearm use configured on an individual basis. Switching the top lock to red forces the pawn to continue using their primary weapon even if other ranged weapon would provide more DPS. Manually switching to a weapon automatically disables autoswitching - this behaviour can be disabled using the bottom lock.

ConceptDef.label: SS: Dropping weapons
ConceptDef.helpText: Depending on the settings, Simple Sidearms can cause colonists to drop their weapons in a variety of situations (default is attacks in melee). Don't worry - your colonists will retrieve their weapons after the fight. \n\nThis is a customizable feature - take a look in the mod settings dialog to learn more.
